greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n^sigma(n) mod sigma(n)^n.
comment: sigma(n) = the sum of the divisors of n (A000203).
formula: a(n) = 0 for numbers n in A300906.
If n is a k-perfect number from A007691, then a(n) = 0 iff k divides n.
maple: with(numtheory): seq(n &^ sigma(n) mod sigma(n)^n,n=1..20); # _Muniru A Asiru_, Mar 20 2018
mathematica: Array[With[{s = DivisorSigma[1, #]}, PowerMod[#, s, s^#]] &, 18] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Mar 16 2018 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(s=sigma(n)); lift(Mod(n, s^n)^s); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Mar 17 2018
results.author: _Jaroslav Krizek_, Mar 14 2018
